snippet: The deaths of 19 men, most of them young, in a fierce wilderness fire stunned a local community that viewed them as heroes.
abstract: Mourners gather in Prescott, Ariz, to honor 19 members of Granite Mountain Hotshots, elite firefighters who died battling fierce wildfire outside old mining village Yarnell; incident is greatest loss of firefighters in a single disaster since attacks of Sept 11, 2001; experts on Western fires say Yarnell Hill blazes, and 15 other large fires that remain uncontained from New Mexico to California to Idaho, are part of new normal in increasingly hot and dry West.

byline.contributor: Ian Lovett contributed reporting from Prescott, Jack Healy from Denver, and Connor Radnovich from New York.

lead_paragraph: The deaths of 19 men, most of them young, in a fierce wilderness fire stunned a local community that viewed them as heroes.

headline.main: Lost in Arizona Fire, an Elite Crew That Rushed In
headline.print_headline: In Arizona, Mourning an Elite Fire Crew That Rushed In Close
